body: Whether it's due to inbreeding, magical or alchemical experimentation, or strange environs, ogres are far more prone to mutations than other races. Ogres can survive with defects that would outright kill members of most other species. Below is a small sample of mutations that might be seen among ogres in a clan.
name: Ogre Simple Templates

sections.body: These tall, bone-thin ogres have thick, bark-like skin and spiked growths all over their bodies, and their hands end in sharp, thorn-like claws.
sections.name: Pickin (CR +0)

sections.body: +2 on AC, –1 hp/HD, and –1 on Fortitude saves and Constitution checks; gains 2 claw attacks (1d6); +4 racial bonus on Stealth checks in forests.
sections.name: Quick Rules

sections.body: Ability Scores –2 Constitution, +2 natural armor bonus; Attacks gains 2 claw attacks (1d6); Special +4 racial bonus on Stealth checks in forests.
sections.name: Rebuild Rules

sections.body: Ogres with the thicken template have huge, oversized heads and razor-sharp teeth.
sections.name: Thicken (CR +0)

sections.body: –1 to AC, ranged attack rolls, initiative, and Dexterity-based skills; gains a bite attack (1d8).
sections.name: Quick Rules

sections.body: Ability Scores –2 Dexterity; Attacks gains a bite attack (1d8) .
sections.name: Rebuild Rules

sections.body: Ogres with the shaggra template are covered in long, matted fur, and have stunted legs and massive oversized arms, similar to apes. They move on all fours and smash enemies with their giant fists.
sections.name: Shaggra (CR +1)

sections.body: +2 on all attack rolls, damage rolls, and Strength checks; gains two slam attacks (1d6); gains the grab and constrict monster special abilities.
sections.name: Quick Rules

sections.body: Ability Scores +4 Strength; Attacks gains 2 slam attacks (1d6, grab, constrict); Special Abilities grab, constrict.
sections.name: Rebuild Rules
